clothing.name: Beaverton Family Resource Center
clothing.notes: Children's clothing and diapers provided through Northwest Children's Outreach. Parenting classes and referrals for energy assistance available. Serving Beaverton area primarily, call in advance. Bus service: MAX Blue or Red

clothing.hours: 9 a.m.- 3 p.m. Mon, Tues, and Wed.
clothing.name: Beaverton Hispanic Resource Center
clothing.notes: English and Spanish classes; assistance for food, employment, and emergency needs. Referrals for clothing, immigration, medical car, domestic violence, and counseling. Translation services and help filling out forms.

clothing.name: Beaverton School District Clothes Closet
clothing.notes: Free clothing for low-income students attending Beaverton schools. Must have admittance slip. Admit slips available from school office. (clothing not provided to adults). Call for information. Bus service: MAX Blue line, 67.

clothing.name: Beaverton Seventh-Day Adventist
clothing.notes: Clients can walk in during open hours to access clothes closet. Bus service: 62, 88.

clothing.name: Birthright of Hillsboro
clothing.notes: Maternity and baby clothes. Free confidential pregnancy tests; help finding medical care, financial assistance, housing, continuing education and relocation. Bus service: 57, MAX Blue line.

clothing.name: Canby Center
clothing.notes: Outreach to the Canby School District community that meets basic needs: food and clothing. Baby/toddler, children’s, maternity, men’s and women’s clothing Call for hours and services.

clothing.name: Dorcas Society-Tualatin
clothing.notes: Provides clothing, bedding and linens for residents of Wilsonville, Tualatin or other nearby towns. Showers available for homeless persons. Bus service: 96

clothing.name: Fish Emergency Services
clothing.notes: Clothing for families in need. Items provided include emergency food boxes, clothing, personal care products (soap, toothpaste, laundry soap, etc.) and referrals for people most in need.

clothing.name: Francis Center
clothing.notes: Free clothing and emergency assistance within boundary area. Boundary area is Clatsop to Powell, 39th-136th; Powell to Glisan, 60th-82nd.

clothing.name: God’s Clothing Central (Gales Creek Church)
clothing.notes: Clothing for all ages and sizes; shoes, coats, and some blankets. On-call appointments only. Leave a message and your call will be returned. Bus service: none

clothing.hours: 9:30 a.m.–12 p.m. Wed. Thursday 4:30 p.m.-6:30 p.m.
clothing.name: Helping Hands (Sunset Presbyterian Church)
clothing.notes: Adult and children’s clothing and shoes are limited to one bag a month. Bus service: 89 .

clothing.address: 451 SE Walnut St. (Use Walnut entrance) David Hill Elementary School
clothing.hours: 9:30 a.m.-6:30 p.m. Mon, Wed, and Thur; 9:30 a.m.-1:30 p.m. Tues.
clothing.name: Hillsboro Family Resource Center
clothing.notes: Food pantry, food boxes, clothing closet, other services.

clothing.name: Love in the Name of Christ of Greater Beaverton
clothing.notes: Basic services and referrals: household goods, linens, baby items; food and clothing referrals provided by local churches. Call for locations. Limited to Beaverton School District boundries.

clothing.name: Our Place Clothes Closet
clothing.notes: Provides quality new and used clothing to persons and families in need in the Hillsboro community; clothing available when church has supplies on hand. A meal is also served during these times. Bus service: MAX Blue line

clothing.name: Portland Police Sunshine Division
clothing.notes: Provides clothing to individuals and families with children under 18 and seniors over 70 and single adults on SSI, SD, or VA pension. Must have Portland address. Please call beforehand.

clothing.name: Portland Rescue Mission
clothing.notes: Clean clothing provided as needed to overnight guests and in emergency situations.

clothing.hours: 10 a.m.-4:15 p.m. Mon., Wed., Thur., and Fri.; 1:30-6:15 p.m. Tues.
clothing.name: Pregnancy Resource Center
clothing.notes: Baby and maternity clothes, baby toys and furnishings. Additional services include pregnancy tests, ultra-sounds, ongoing peer-counseling, pregnancy and fetal development information, information on abortion risks, procedures and alternatives, adoption information and referrals, parenting classes, referrals for medical care, housing, legal aid, others.

clothing.name: Rose Haven
clothing.notes: Women and children only: Access center for clothing, hygiene, mailing address and voice mail. Advocacy and referral for health care, nutrition, housing, employment and other social services. Groups and classes include Rent Well.

clothing.hours: 10 a.m.-2 p.m. Mon, Wed, Thurs, Fri. 10am-4pm Tues.
clothing.notes: Clothing for adulst and chilrden. Six times a yaer only. Energy assistance with proof of address. Serves only east of 82nd Ave.

clothing.hours: 10 a.m.-2 p.m. Mon and Thurs, 2-6 p.m.
clothing.name: Southeast Community Church of the Nazarene
clothing.notes: Clothes closet, one bag. Dependent upon availability.

Clothing once every 30 days. Sleeping bags and backpacks depending on availability (Fri.). Other services include sleeping blankets, phone calls, hair care & foot care (Wed), prescription assistance (non-narcotic), travel assistance and help procuring birth certificates. Mon.-Fri.

clothing.address: 9000 SW Durham Road, Portable 716 Tigard High School
clothing.name: Tigard/Tualatin Family Resource Center
clothing.notes: Small clothing closet and limited amount of baby diapers and formula. Call for information and appointments. Information and refferal service available via Tigard/Tualaton School. Call for information. Bus service: 76.

clothing.address: 9000 SW Durham Road- Portable 716 Tigard High School
clothing.name: Tigard/Tualatin School District-Caring Closet
clothing.notes: Provides clothing to Tigard/Tualatin School District students with a referral from their child’s school principal, counselor or teacher. Thurs. Bus service: 76

clothing.name: Tod’s Corner
clothing.notes: Clothing, household goods, cleaning supplies, personal care items & pet food and other services as requested. Clients must have HIV/AIDS and have a referral from a case manager.

Clothing room open 10a-11 & 6p-7, Mon.-Fri.; 8a-12p, weekends/holidays. Once outfit per day. Showers available for men and women; 7a-11. Call for info about ID assistance, Mailing address, food boxes, day lockers and phone access.

clothing.name: Union Gospel Mission
clothing.notes: Provides clothing to people in need.
